verses.verse: Thus the Lord <WH136> Yahweh <WH136> showed <WH7200> me: <WH3619> behold, a basket of summer fruit. <WH7019>

He said, <WH559> "370, <WH5986> what do you see? <WH7200>" I said, <WH559> "A basket <WH3619> of summer fruit. <WH7019>" Then Yahweh <WH3068> said <WH559> to me, <WH7093> "The end has come <WH935> on my people <WH5971> Israel. <WH3478> I will not again <WH3254> pass by them any more. <WH5674>

The songs <WH7892> of the temple <WH1964> will be wailings <WH3213> in that day, <WH3117>" says <WH5002> the Lord <WH136> Yahweh. <WH3069> "The dead bodies <WH6297> will be many. <WH7227> In every place <WH4725> they will throw them out <WH7993> with silence. <WH2013>
Hear <WH8085> this, <WH7602> you who desire to swallow up the needy, <WH34> and cause <WH7673> the poor <WH6041> of the land <WH776> to fail, <WH7673>

Saying, <WH559> <WH2320> 'When will the new moon be gone, <WH5674> that we may sell <WH7666> grain? <WH7668> And the Sabbath, <WH7676> that we may market <WH6605> wheat, <WH1250> making the ephah <WH374> small, <WH6994> and the shekel <WH8255> large, <WH1431> and dealing falsely <WH5791> with balances <WH3976> of deceit; <WH4820>
that we may buy <WH7069> the poor <WH1800> for silver, <WH3701> and the needy <WH34> for a pair of shoes, <WH5275> and sell <WH7666> the sweepings <WH4651> with the wheat? <WH1250>'"
Yahweh <WH3068> has sworn <WH7650> by the pride <WH1347> of Jacob, <WH3290> "Surely I will never <WH5331> forget <WH7911> any of their works. <WH4639>

Won't <WH776> the land tremble <WH7264> for this, <WH56> and everyone mourn who dwells <WH3427> in it? <WH5927> Yes, it will rise up wholly like the River; <WH2975> and it will be stirred <WH1644> up and sink <WH8257> again, <WH216> like the River of Egypt. <WH4714>

It will happen in that day, <WH3117>" says <WH5002> the Lord <WH136> Yahweh, <WH3069> "that I will cause the sun <WH8121> to go down <WH935> at noon, <WH6672> and I will darken <WH2821> the earth <WH776> in the clear <WH216> day. <WH3117>

I will turn <WH2015> your feasts <WH2282> into mourning, <WH60> and all your songs <WH7892> into lamentation; <WH7015> and I will make <WH5927> you wear sackcloth <WH8242> on all your bodies, <WH4975> and baldness <WH7144> on every head. <WH7218> I will make <WH7760> it like the mourning <WH60> for an only <WH3173> son, <WH319> and its end like a bitter <WH4751> day. <WH3117>

Behold, <WH3117> the days come, <WH935>" says <WH5002> the Lord <WH136> Yahweh, <WH136> "that I will send <WH7971> a famine <WH7458> in the land, <WH776> not a famine <WH7458> of bread, <WH3899> nor a thirst <WH6772> for water, <WH4325> but of hearing <WH8085> the words <WH1697> of Yahweh. <WH3068>

They will wander <WH5128> from sea <WH3220> to sea, <WH3220> and from the north <WH6828> even to the east; <WH4217> they will run back and forth <WH7751> to seek <WH1245> the word <WH1697> of Yahweh, <WH3068> and will not find it. <WH4672>
In that day <WH3117> the beautiful <WH3303> virgins <WH1330> and the young men <WH970> will faint <WH5968> for thirst. <WH6772>

Those who swear <WH7650> by the sin <WH819> of Samaria, <WH8111> and say, <WH559> <WH430> 'As your god, Dan, <WH1835> lives; <WH2416>' and, <WH1870> 'As the way of Beersheba <WH884> lives; <WH2416>' they will fall, <WH5307> and never rise up again. <WH6965>"
